result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith A Kearns was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 45 days Marathon County Jail total: 6 days to be served with 39 days imposed and stayed as defendant is elegible for SSTOP Program, with huber for work/treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, to begin within 45 days, in effect for no more than one year - once defendant is in full compliance with the drivers safety plan, SSTOP program is terminated.

Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant him/herself, both for a period of 12 months.  IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keith A Kearns

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CM1628, 15FO408 and 15TR3984 called: 9:17am
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher.  Def appears in person/pro se.

State moves to:
15FO408>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE
COURT deems refusal in 15TR3984 lawful upon request of State.

PLEA:
15CM1628 - Ct. 1 (OWI 2nd)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self; a factual basis & def guilty

COURT ORDERS: $1379 inclusive plus payment of AODA fees; 45 days MCJ Total: 6 days to be served with 39 days I&S as Defendant is eligible for SSTOP Program, w/huber for work/treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, to begin within 45 days, in effect for no more than one year- once defendant is in full compliance with drivers safety plan, SSTOP program is terminated; 12 month DL Rev w/credit;   Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant him/herself, both for a period of 12 months; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid; AODA (deemed completed); DNA sample and surcharge.

Adj: 9:30am

Plea hearing at 10-20-2015 09:20 am.
Final pre-trial at 11-12-2015 09:00 am.
Jury Trial at 12-02-2015 08:15 am.
Ltr from Marathon County Sheriff's Dept re issuance of PAC citation #Q759335-3

Shall not consume alcohol.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.    Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 within 5 business days.
